tomato.sterilization: Wash explants under running tap water for 10–15 minutes with mild detergent; treat with 2–3 drops of Tween-20 for 5 minutes; rinse thoroughly. Transfer to laminar airflow hood. Dip in 70% ethanol for 30–45 seconds. Sterilize using 0.1% HgCl2 or 2% NaOCl for 6–12 minutes depending on tissue hardness. Rinse 4–5 times with sterile distilled water to remove all traces of sterilant.

shoot_induction.medium: Murashige and Skoog (MS) basal medium supplemented with: 1–3 mg/L BAP, 0.1–0.5 mg/L NAA, 30 g/L sucrose, 8 g/L agar; pH adjusted to 5.8.
shoot_induction.conditions: Incubate at 25 ± 2°C under a 16/8 h photoperiod with 40–60 µmol/m²/s light intensity. Monitor for shoot initiation after 7–14 days.

rooting.medium: Half-strength MS medium supplemented with 0.5–1.5 mg/L IBA or 1 mg/L NAA; 25 g/L sucrose; 6–8 g/L agar.
rooting.duration: Roots typically emerge within 10–20 days depending on species.

tomato.hardening: Gently remove rooted plantlets and wash agar from roots. Transfer to trays containing cocopeat:perlite:vermiculite (1:1:1). Maintain high humidity in a mist chamber for 7 days. Gradually reduce humidity and expose to indirect sunlight. After 10–14 days, transfer to polybags containing soil:sand:compost (1:1:1). Harden for 2–3 weeks before field planting.

capsicum.hardening: Gently remove rooted plantlets and wash agar from roots. Transfer to trays containing cocopeat:perlite:vermiculite (1:1:1). Maintain high humidity in a mist chamber for 7 days. Gradually reduce humidity and expose to indirect sunlight. After 10–14 days, transfer to polybags containing soil:sand:compost (1:1:1). Harden for 2–3 weeks before field planting.

eggplant.sterilization: Wash explants under running tap water for 10–15 minutes with mild detergent; treat with 2–3 drops of Tween-20 for 5 minutes; rinse thoroughly. Transfer to laminar airflow hood. Dip in 70% ethanol for 30–45 seconds. Sterilize using 0.1% HgCl2 or 2% NaOCl for 6–12 minutes depending on tissue hardness. Rinse 4–5 times with sterile distilled water to remove all traces of sterilant.

shoot_induction.medium: Murashige and Skoog (MS) basal medium supplemented with: 1–3 mg/L BAP, 0.1–0.5 mg/L NAA, 30 g/L sucrose, 8 g/L agar; pH adjusted to 5.8.
shoot_induction.conditions: Incubate at 25 ± 2°C under a 16/8 h photoperiod with 40–60 µmol/m²/s light intensity. Monitor for shoot initiation after 7–14 days.

pine.sterilization: Wash explants under running tap water for 10–15 minutes with mild detergent; treat with 2–3 drops of Tween-20 for 5 minutes; rinse thoroughly. Transfer to laminar airflow hood. Dip in 70% ethanol for 30–45 seconds. Sterilize using 0.1% HgCl2 or 2% NaOCl for 6–12 minutes depending on tissue hardness. Rinse 4–5 times with sterile distilled water to remove all traces of sterilant.

shoot_induction.medium: Murashige and Skoog (MS) basal medium supplemented with: 1–3 mg/L BAP, 0.1–0.5 mg/L NAA, 30 g/L sucrose, 8 g/L agar; pH adjusted to 5.8.
shoot_induction.conditions: Incubate at 25 ± 2°C under a 16/8 h photoperiod with 40–60 µmol/m²/s light intensity. Monitor for shoot initiation after 7–14 days.

rooting.medium: Half-strength MS medium supplemented with 0.5–1.5 mg/L IBA or 1 mg/L NAA; 25 g/L sucrose; 6–8 g/L agar.
rooting.duration: Roots typically emerge within 10–20 days depending on species.
